there's another way, mate

illustrations by asylum seekers

materialise

These objects are made from found materials using improvised techniques.

Designed and developed by asylum seekers held in offshore detention.

Their instructions brings these objects to life for others to materialise.

materialise

These objects are made from found materials using improvised techniques. Designed and developed by asylum seekers held in offshore detention. Their instructions brings these objects to life for others to materialise.

dambura
  • gather
  • make
  • play
  • share

A Dambura, or Dombra, is a traditional Afghani instrument and sounds like this.
Watch and listen to this Dambura here. Build and share your own Dambura at #mate_rialise

Tuning: G (top string) E (bottom string)

Build and share your own kite at #mate_rialise

follow

This project has been conducted using first-hand accounts and the confidentiality of those participants is placed as a priority. To protect their identity, all contributors will remain anonymous.


Supported By: Addison Road Community Centre

Special thanks to Lucy Nixon, Nick Burns, Rosy Porter, Ben Zerbes, Isaac Martin, Cazz Hunter, Thanda Ko Gyi, Will & Jess Pippen.

Website developed by Isaac Martin
